tn.text: The word "eighth" is the ordinal number for eight. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"to Yahweh" or "in the presence of Yahweh"
Moses continues speaking to Aaron.

tn.ref: You must speak to the people of Israel and say, 'Take a male goat ... will appear to you
tn.text: Moses continues speaking to Aaron. This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "And tell the people of Israel to take a male goat ... will appear to all the people" (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
"twelve months of age"
"to sacrifice to Yahweh"
Here "you" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: so that his glory may appear to you
tn.text: Here "glory" represents the presence of Yahweh. AT: "so that he may show you the glory of his presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: make atonement for yourself and for the people ... offer the sacrifice for the people to make atonement for them
tn.text: These are two different sacrifices. The first sacrifice is to atone for the sins of the high priest. When the high priest sins it also makes the people guilty (See: [[:en:bible:notes:lev:04:01|4:3]]). The second sacrifice is to atone of the sins the people themselves commit.

tn.ref: sons of Aaron presented the blood to him
tn.text: This implies that they caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained from the animal. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the corners of the altar. They are shaped like the horns of an ox. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:04:06|4:7]].

tn.ref: at the base of the altar
tn.text: "at the bottom of the altar"
"Aaron burned"
Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
This is the coat or skin of a herd animal. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:07|7:8]].

tn.ref: his sons gave him the blood
tn.text: It is implied that the sons caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained from the animal. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
the inner parts - This is the stomach and intestines. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]].
The word "first" is the ordinal number for one. AT: "the goat for his own offering" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: along with the morning's burnt offering
tn.text: This refers to the first sacrifice of each day. The priests would offer this burnt sacrifice in the morning before any other sacrifice. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Aaron killed"

tn.ref: Aaron's sons gave him the blood
tn.text: It is implied that the blood was in a bowl. The full meaning of this statement may be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the stomach and intestines. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]].
Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
"Aaron's sons took the parts"
The word "these" refers to the fat and inner parts listed previously.
This is front part of the animal's body below the neck. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:28|7:30]].
This is the upper part of the leg above the knee. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:31|7:32]].
"to Yahweh"
The phrase "came down" is used because the place of the altar was higher than where the people were standing.

tn.ref: the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the people
tn.text: Here "glory" represents Yahweh's presence. AT: "Yahweh showed all the people the glory of his presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Fire came out from Yahweh and consumed
tn.text: "Yahweh sent a fire that consumed"
The fire completely burning up the offering is spoken of as if the fire consumed or used up the burnt offering. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"lay with their faces to the ground." This is a sign respect and honor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
